Context: The George Brown College offers various programs including English as a Second Language (ESL), preparatory programs for post-secondary education, a General Arts and Science Two-Year diploma program with transfer credits to the University of Toronto, immigrant bridging programs, Occupation Specific Language Training (OSLT), College Teacher Training, and Workplace Communication for Nurses. They also support newcomers to Canada and offer land acknowledgment information. Application deadlines, college news, upcoming events, tours, and other relevant information can be obtained by signing up on their website or contacting ask.george@georgebrown.ca. The phone number is 416-415-2000 with a TTY number of 1-877-515-5559. Their social media hub can also be visited for more information. The college's website contains information that is subject to change without notice and students are responsible for verifying fee requirements.
